text: I've got a funny feeling about this Finals.
Today's Undisputed podcast: https://t.co/OA90o9B86H
Are the Lakers getting serious about drafting LiAngelo? Unfortunately, this is our final topic today. But we will return tomorrow as always. 9:30 AM-Noon ET on FS1
The Warriors are vulnerable. More @Undisputed, now on FS1 https://t.co/64GzEYM7C8
Does keeping Nick Foles mean the Eagles are worried about Carson Wentz? Next on @undisputed
Would upsetting the Warriors move LeBron ahead of Michael Jordan? Now on @undisputed
How are the Patriots still favored to win the Super Bowl with the 17th-ranked defense? Now on @undisputed
How should LeBron feel about potentially signing with the 76ers in light of the Bryan Colangelo situation? Next on @undisputed
How big of an upset would it really be if LeBron beat the Warriors? @undisputed. 9:30 AM ET. FS1
Today's Undisputed podcast: https://t.co/EDhIrHcGKB

James Harden is going to win this year’s regular season MVP. But when the stakes are highest, you cannot trust him. He doesn’t have that playoff “It” factor. More @Undisputed, now on FS1 https://t.co/S5JlpmHuXN
LeBron is a 12-point underdog in Game 1 against the Warriors. His Finals resume is about to take another hit, a 6th loss. More @Undisputed, now on FS1 https://t.co/GUgurZMTaA
Jason Terry joins us to debate Warriors/Rockets and LeBron vs Jordan. Next on @undisputed

Also today: How much is James Harden to blame for the Rockets failure? Is Steph right about LeBron's "help" deserving more credit? Does Kyrie have a legitimate excuse for missing Game 7? Why are so many players taking shots at the Patriots for having "no fun?" @undisputed. FS1.
Will this Finals help or hurt LeBron's case against Michael Jordan? @undisputed. 9:30 AM ET. FS1
Rockets went 1-21 from 3 in the second half??? That's home Game 7 pressure wrapped around the throats of a team there for the first time.
Sorry about that, LeBron. Too bad about being 3-6 in NBA Finals. You'll have as many losses as MJ had wins without a loss.

Kevin Durant went from playing 2 1/2 awful games ... to looking like The Best Player on the Planet in the second half of this Game 7. Way to go, KD. Can't wait to see LeShannon Sharpe's face at 9:30 E on FS1. Warriors are about to be UNDISPUTED again.
Harden 2-13 from 3. Gordon 2-12. Ariza 0-9. That's 30 missed threes. That's how you blow a home Game 7.
James Harden is made only for the regular season.
The Rockets in total missed 27 threes in a row before PJTucker finally made that one??? It's really a shame they're having to play this Game 7 without CP3 on the floor.
The Rockets have now missed a playoff record 25 straight threes??? Home Game 7s will do that to you. See Celtics.
Finally, KD is turning back into KD.
UNBELIEVABLE. I didn't think the Rockets would allow the Warriors to third-quarter them AGAIN. Golden State 33, Houston 15 in that quarter. Got Stephed AGAIN. You there James?
Only hope the Warriors have now is if Harden reverts to "Playoff James."
I can't imagine the Warriors playing a worse first half, especially in a Game 7. Just hard to watch. LeBron has to be cheering like crazy for the Rockets.
Kevin Durant is playing like a man who got his ring and his Finals MVP and his validation and vindication for leaving Westbrook ... like last season was all he really wanted or needed.
Houston just wants this game a whole lot more than Golden State. Warriors just look like they've run out of mental gas. ADVANTAGE, LEBRON.
Draymond is almost as big a mess right now as KD.
Kevin Durant has lost his confidence, his flow, his fire. That's the biggest reason the Warriors are in danger of losing this game.

What a terrible start for Golden State: 2 quick turnovers and now three fouls on the Warrior who was most valuable on offense and defense on Saturday night, Klay Thompson. Now no Klay or Iggy to guard JHarden.
LeBron has had several better big games than last night's.

Amusing to me that Ty Lue called last night LeBron's greatest game. The too-green Celts missed 32 threes! LeBron was his usual dominant self vs a team with no one who can defend him. But he had eight turnovers and now leads the playoffs in turnovers by 14!
LeBron got one big break in the East when Boston upset Philly. He would get another big one tonight if the Rockets upset the Warriors.
God bless all those who have served or are serving or defending the greatest country in the world. This day is for you, and we thank you.
Today's Undisputed podcast: https://t.co/hhkaWPBCkn
Jason Terry joins us to to debate whether last night was LeBron's greatest game, LeBron's 8 straight Eastern Conference titles, and Warriors/Rockets Game 7. Next on @undisputed
LeBron should have ended this series in 6. What happened last night should have happened much earlier. More @Undisputed, now on FS1 https://t.co/8DbqnbQqWQ

Also today: Was last night LeBron's greatest game? Is reaching the NBA Finals with this Cavs team LeBron's greatest achievement? How impressive are LeBron's 8 straight Eastern Conference titles? How impressive was LeBron's block? Who wins Game 7 tonight?
Does that close the case: LeBron is better than Jordan? We debate. @undisputed. 9:30 AM ET. FS1
LeBron James sure did have a lot of help tonight.
This is smart: LeBron is crediting his teammates while all the ESPN questions are about how carrying this (sorry) team to the Finals is "the greatest achievement ever."
This is funny: LeBron is now lying on the floor during the championship presentation, sending the message to Blind Witnesses he carried a heavy load the whole game and throughout the playoffs.
I'm a Kyrie fan but (unless he had a legit excuse) I'm very disappointed he wasn't at the game tonight. The Celtics could've at least used his presence on the bench and in the huddle.
Terry Rozier, Jaylen Brown and Marcus Smart combined to go 3-26 from 3. Most of 'em were WIDE OPEN. This stage was just too big for these Celtics, as I predicted it would be.

I predicted 39/15/12 for LeBron. He had 35/15/9. LeShannon Sharpe bet me a case of Diet Dew that LeBron would score 50+ tonight. I win again. I CAN'T WAIT FOR TOMORROW'S UNDISPUTEDL 9:30-NOON E, FS1. I sure hope Shannon wears his goat mask.

It's laughable to think winning the Least with this team was some great achievement by LeBron. Victor Oladipo's Indiana? The same sorry Raptors they swept LAST YEAR? The overachieving Celtics without two All-Stars??? Huh? LeBron's Cavs SHOULD'VE won the Least.
Boston just massacred itself.
The Cavs have finally done what they should've done in five games. They're just better than Boston. They have LeBron James. The Celtics didn't have Kyrie or Hayward. Shame it took so long.
Terry Rozier has been shockingly Scary for Celtics fans. He has simply shot his team right out of this game.
DRIVE IT, LEBRON.
That was not a foul.
JUST ATTACK, LEBRON.
LeBron just got posterized by Jayson Tatum.
Poor Jayson Tatum just doesn't have enough help. Rozier and Jaylen Brown are a combined 2-18 from 3.
AGAIN: NO CELTIC CAN KEEP LEBRON FROM THE RIM OR THE FREE-THROW LINE. THIS GAME IS ON A SILVER PLATTER FOR HIM. Home, James.
The Celtics are just pitiful offensively. Hard to fathom how they're still in this game.
Come on, King, put this thing away.
The Boston Celtics in a home Game 7 are 4-26 from 3 through 3 quarters. That's 15%. Somewhere, Larry Bird is shaking his head and mumbling something unprintable.
Hustle, LeBron, it isn't over yet ... but it's close to being.
I'm sorry, I can't get excited about 6-9 LeBron blocking 6-1 Rozier who can't buy a basket and WHO GOT FOULED BY LEBRON ON THE HAND ANY WAY.
REMINDER: Shannon Sharpe and I will be live as always tomorrow morning for a holiday Undisputed, 9:30-noon E on FS1. JOIN US FOR A LEBRONATHON.
We've seen enough brick-laying so far by both teams to build a new Garden.
Now the pressure will start getting to the Celtics, who know they're not supposed to be here and have never been under this kind of one-game-away-from-the-Finals heat.
Five more turnovers in the first half, LeBron??? Come on, King, you're better than that.
Rookie Jayson Tatum needs a lot more help.

LeBron basically played 1-man zone defense again, standing under the basket. Hence, 10 rebounds. His man hit some open shots, missed several more. Celts shot only 38.6 %. THEY'RE A BELOW-AVERAGE OFFENSIVE TEAM WITHOUT KYRIE.
Great flop by Marcus Smart.
Nance's 3rd foul is trouble for the Cavs.
Again: the Celtics have NOBODY who can keep LeBron from the rim or the free-throw line.
Tonight, the Celts will miss Kyrie. They've overachieved sensationally to this point. But in Game 7 vs the King, they wake up and turn back into pumpkins.

After Kevin Love was lost early in Game 6, I was pleasantly surprised by the energy Larry Nance Jr. provided. His young legs and hustle on both ends are just what the Cavs will need tonight against the high-energy scratch-and-claw Celts. Tonight, the Cavs won't miss Love.
LeBron OWES his team for his bizarre LeTired night in Game 5. And I believe he will pay his team back with a big game tonight: 39/15/12. Cavs by 10, 105-95.
Harden turned back into "Playoff James" ... "Way Off" James ... in the 2nd half as the Houston Rockets managed all of TWENTY-FIVE points.
Now we see who can get/stay healthy for Game 7: CP3 or Iggy or neither or both. If both play, and play effectively, I still like Golden State. If only CP3 can go ...

Klay Thompson saved the Warriors' season. Great to see because he's the most likable Warrior. He has sacrificed the most, maintained humility. But when he's needed, he's every bit the shooter Steph is.
Draymond is playing almost as stunningly poorly as Durant. But so far Klay has saved them.
James Harden should be much better under mounting 2nd-half pressure that usually derails him because he's working with a home Game 7 safety net.
Kevin Durant looks distracted. Off-court drama? Too many Silicon Valley investments to keep up with? Not as hungry after he won his ring and Finals MVP? I don't know, but something is not right.

KD: 3-11 from floor. Steph: 1-7 from 3. Rockets: plus 21 from 3, outshooting the Warriors 11-4 from 3. Rockets, playing harder and smarter. Steve Kerr, too nice and supportive to light the angry halftime fire this team now desperately needs.
I still expect one big Steph-fueled run from the Warriors.
Golden State of shock. Rockets are just firing at will from 3, with nothing to lose but going home for Game 7, while the Warriors are playing tighter and tighter as do turns into die.
Kevin Durant, reigning Finals MVP, former MVP, 4-time NBA scoring champ, has turned into a no-confidence mess, thanks mostly to the savvy and physicality of PJ Tucker.
What a low-pressure opportunity this is for James Harden to redeem his postseason legacy.
The Celtics have sensationally overachieved to get this far. Hope they enjoyed it while it lasted.
The Boston Celtics are really going to miss Kyrie tomorrow night.

The best game I ever saw LeBron James play was Game 6 of the East finals in 2012. Extreme pressure, elimination game ... in the same arena he'll play Game 7 in tomorrow night. He's had many explosive nights in this building. Does not bode well for the Celtics. Good luck, Green.
LeBron finishes with 46/11/9. I predicted 44/12/10. JOIN ME ON FACEBOOK IN COUPLE OF MINUTES.
How many LeBron misses at the rim have been followed by him or teammates? Those second-chance points are the difference in the game right now.
I WILL GO LIVE ON FACEBOOK SOON AFTER THIS GAME ENDS. JOIN ME.
What?! 6-4 Marcus Smart just rejected a 6-9 LeBron dunk attempt at the rim?! How embarrassing for a player who's "better than Michael Jordan."
Whether Kevin Love will be cleared to play Sunday's Game 7 will be a  big deal. Not obviously CP3 big but Love was leading the NBA playoffs in rebounds.
The Celtics did not believe they would win in the King's house tonight and I don't believe they believe they can beat LeBron in a Game 7 in Boston.

The Cavs just did in the 2nd quarter what I thought they'd do in the 1st: They won the 2nd 34-18! Made the Celts look ordinary on offense, which they are. The King should get some 4th-quarter rest ahead of Game 7.

Dominant 1st half by LeBron, who did exactly what he needed to do. Played all 24 minutes. Only 1 turnover. Locked in. Attacking. Shooting it with conviction and smooth confidence. He has taken care of business.
FYI, Jayson Tatum did stay in the game after he hit heads with Kevin Love. But he sure has been quiet since. Maybe he's feeling the effects, too.
Bring on Game 7.
Man, LeBron is getting a shocking amount of help from Korver, Jeff Green, Nance Jr and Clarkson. Who knew any of these guys could play a lick? Thought the King would have to do this by himself.

As usual, LeBron can score at the rim just about any time he wants. But the Celts were getting just about anything they wanted on offense, too. I thought the Cavs would home-court blitz them in the 1st quarter. Nope. Boston, 25-20.
Obviously if Kevin Love is diagnosed with a concussion, that will be a huge loss for the Cavs. He's an All-Star who has played in lots of high-stakes playoff games.
No more LeTired for the rest of these playoffs. He's greater than that.

I got LeBron big tonight. Re-imposes his will on Kyrie-less Celts. 44/12/10. Cavs 115-90. This is just a formality before Sunday's Game 7 back in Boston. But I do hope the King got a long nap today and drank plenty of fluids. #StriveForGreatness
Today's Undisputed podcast: https://t.co/BCCK2qPRuM

In Michael Jordan's 11 full seasons with the Chicago Bulls, he made Second Team All-NBA as a rookie then 10 straight First Teams. And 7 of those First Teams featured all Hall of Famers. More @Undisputed, now on FS1 https://t.co/YG0mWv9ejU
What did CP3’s mock shimmy say to Steph? Now on @undisputed
What has happened to James Harden? Now on @undisputed
Will Johnny Football struggle in Canada? Shannon says yes. I say no. Next on @undisputed
I'm out. Kevin Durant was a disaster last night, just as he was a disaster in Game 4. More @Undisputed, now on FS1 https://t.co/Wdzs7vrs3o
Why Kevin Durant is no longer my best player on the planet. Now on @undisputed
Could LeBron go for 50 tonight? Does LeBron’s record of 12 1st-Team All-NBA make him better than Michael Jordan? Next on @undisputed
I'm about to unleash on the Warriors - especially on Kevin Durant and Steve Kerr. @undisputed. 9:30 AM ET. FS1
Obviously the huge wide-open shot poor Quinn Cook was forced to take (because CP3 had pulled his hamstring at the other end) would usually have been taken by the injured Andre Iguodala.

After winning 10 straight cases of Diet Mt Dew from my man Shannon Sharpe, I've now lost 2 straight. Not looking forward to tomorrow's Undisputed, 9:30 E, FS1. Hey, King, you might not have to deal with Golden State after all. ANOTHER huge break.

I've said since last year's Finals, when Kevin Durant won MVP,  that HE'S The Best Player on the Planet. No more. Not after the last two games, when he got roughed up and intimidated and ran from the ball late tonight. Extremely disappointed in him ... as I am in LeTired.
Now we await news on Chris Paul's pulled hamstring. He once eliminated my Spurs on a pulled hamstring.
Warriors again got shockingly bullied by the Rockets' defense - especially KD. Only way they hung in was "Playoff James" went 0-11 from 3 and 5-21 overall.

What an abomination of a finish and game for the reigning champs. They someone had 3 shocking opportunities to win and take command. Quinn Cook, wide-open miss. Steph, tough close miss. Draymond unforced embarrassment of a butter-fingered turnover.
Kevin Durant is just stinking this up. Warriors are hanging in in spite of him.
Chris Paul is out of his mind. Never seen him like this with the stakes this high.
No way the Warriors can overcome Houston's crowd, defense and CP3 shot-making in this 4th quarter.
Kevin Durant is coming apart.
The Rockets just dominated the Warriors, 45-45.
Surprised no Iggy. Rockets should win this fairly easily.
Did Zeke deserve to drop from 7th to 54th in the NFL’s Top 100 list? Next on @undisputed
Desiigner joins us to debate LeBron, Warriors and Kanye. Now on @undisputed
How much of a pass does LeBron deserve for getting tired? Now on @undisputed
How much trouble are the Warriors in? Now on @undisputed

Right from the start, it looked like LeBron was a little lethargic, a little lackadaisical, not really into it, and sometimes just flat-out out of it. More @Undisputed, now on FS1 https://t.co/0vezcgE8Px
How much trouble are the Cavs in? Up next on @undisputed
Our final thoughts on the NFL’s new protest policy. Now on @undisputed
We’re about to react to the Sterling Brown video. Next on @undisputed
Desiigner joins us to debate LeBron, Warriors and Kanye. @undisputed. 9:30 AM ET. FS1
We are about to debate LeTired. @undisputed. 9:30 AM ET. FS1
LeBron's the goat ... of this game.
I'm about to unleash live on Facebook.

This is just pathetic, LeBron is sitting on the scorer's table chugging water trying to show the gullible Wintesses he's "dehydrated." Next, we'll hear he's suffering from Chronic Fatigue Syndrome. Unreal.
What is LeBron DOING???
OK, NO MATTER WHAT HAPPENS FROM HERE ON, I'M GOING LIVE ON FACEBOOK JUST AFTER THIS GAME ENDS TO GIVE MY IMMEDIATE GUT REACTION AHEAD OF TOMORROW'S UNDISPUTED. JOIN ME.
TAKE IT TO THE BASKET, LEBRON. THEY CAN'T SCORE.
This is where the Celts miss Kyrie. No closer.
This game is sitting on a silver platter for the King, if he can reach down for the energy.
Remember, the Celts struggled like crazy to close out Game 2 at home. Just couldn't buy a basket for 7 straight 4th-quarter minutes.
Warriors were up 12 at this point at home last night.
Yes, the Cavs' starting backcourt, JR and GHill, are just 2-10. BUT ... the Celts starting backcourt, JBrown and Rozier, are 4-20.
I have to believe LeBron is saving himself for a huge 4th-quarter run that would just rip the basketball hearts out of the Celtics and their fans.

When LeBron throws up a LEFT-HANDED air ball in the lane, it sends the wrong message to his teammates: "I'm not taking this that seriously." He can score at will at the rim on this team. Lock in, King.
First half was pretty simple: Celts just wanted it more than the Cavs.

LeBron's Team didn't play with near the energy and urgency on defense they did at home. This looks like the team that finished 29th of 30 teams in defense. Way too easy for a Celts team that ranked 18th on offense.

LeBron can score at the rim on the Celtics any time he wants ... if he doesn't run out of gas. Sixers would've been a different story with Embiid and Simmons patrolling the paint. But LeBron can take over this game whenever he wants.

LeBron is tired AGAIN??? Has looked a little lethargic all night. Isn't he supposed to be the world's finest conditioned athlete? MJ never got tired. MJ played all 82 nine times. This was the first year LeBron played all 82. Is he sick? Hurt? I just don't get it.
No 1, Marcus Morris fouled Nance in breaking up the pass. No. 2 Morris blatantly taunted him. Yet the Celts get TWO techs for retaliation? Not right.
Cavs 102, Celtics 96.

Come on, King, 4 quarters of all-out on offense AND defense. Be Jordanesque. None of this, "I'm No. 1 in the NBA in being tired after games." Please. No cruising or resting on either end. Take care of business. Put 'em away.
Today's Undisputed podcast: https://t.co/57DNDxZgRs
The Rockets imposed their defensive will on the Warriors and refused to go away. They said, 'Nope, we're not going to quit.' More @Undisputed, now on FS1 https://t.co/KhpehyCjmd
Who deserves more blame for the Warriors loss: Steph or KD? We debate. Now on @undisputed
Former Patriots defensive coordinator Eric Mangini gives us his inside take on Brady vs Belichick. Now on @undisputed
Shannon now says LeBron is greater than Jordan. I laugh at that. LeBron’s former teammate Eddie House is about to pick a side. Next on @undisputed
I'm just dying for Kevin Durant to get to the basket. This is the best free throw shooter in the postseason. He's made all 27 in this series. More @Undisputed, now on FS1 https://t.co/ISYSQfU2hM
What did James Harden and Chris Paul do for their postseason legacies last night? Coming up on @undisputed
How badly did Kevin Durant botch that last play for the Warriors? @undisputed. 9:30 AM ET. FS1
James Harden, 3-12 from 3. Eric Gordon, 1-8 from 3. And the Rpckets suffocated the Warriors in the 4th quarter, holding them to 12 points and one assist at Roaracle. Just mind-boggling.

I just lost a "cinch" bet to Shannon Sharpe after winning 10 straight from him. As my wife Ernestine always reminds me, "There's no such thing as a sure thing." Now I'm dreading 9:30 E on FS1. Nooooooooooo!

I can't believe 1) the Golden State Warriors wound up with nothing more than a forced-up Klay Thompson air ball to tie or win and 2) Steph Curry badly missed a wide-open 3 to tie. Just pathetic. Got physically/psychologically bullied by Houston's defense.
The Rockets are now in commanding position to achieve their ultimate goal of dethroning the Warriors. Did not see this coming. Much respect to the Rockets.
Incredibly, the Rockets' defense has completely taken the Warriors out of everything they do on offense.
Golden State is going to lose this game. Gave Houston its two best shots, 1st and 3rd quarter, but the Rockets wouldn't give up, wanted it more.
What is Kevin Durant DOING???
If the Warriors are going to win this game, Kevin Durant is going to have to play like the reigning Finals MVP.
Draymond had better make these free throws to make up for getting his dunk blocked by the rim.

I shouldn't have guaranteed victory over Shannon on today's Undisputed. He gave me Golden State straight up in Game 4. Jinxed myself. Of course, Shannon just doesn't want LeBron to have to face the Warriors again.

I'm in danger of losing a rare bet to Shannon Sharpe. No Iggy. Klay gimpy. Steph, foul trouble. KD, hit & miss. Dubs went into cruise control up 12-0. Now Rockets are imposing their physical will on 'em. Could lead series 2-2.
James Harden just made up for the 3 he turned down by absolutely POSTERIZING Draymond. Didn't think James had that in him. Huge for his teammates.
Today's Undisputed podcast: https://t.co/guICX5U5JE
LeBron is not the scorer Kevin Durant is or Michael Jordan was because that’s what they did. They scored at will. More @Undisputed, now on FS1 https://t.co/VAf9d528i5
Kyle Korver had three blocks. He blocked Jaylen Brown twice. You're telling me LeBron doesn't have enough help? More @Undisputed, now on FS1 https://t.co/7YdhYzJmFl
Have the Celtics been overrated? Now on @undisputed
What everybody keeps missing about these postseason records LeBron keeps setting. Now on @undisputed
Brady continues to rebel against Belichick. Now on @undisputed
The Cavaliers are going to win Game 5, and they're going to win Game 6. It is over. The Celtics looked like the Boston Raptors. More @Undisputed, now on FS1 https://t.co/8wP88MDL9K
What we learned about Baker Mayfield last night at the Cavs game. Now on @undisputed
We're about to debate LeBron's profane response when asked about resting while he's on the court. Now on @undisputed
Will LeShannon wear his GOAT mask again today? @undisputed. 9:30 AM ET. FS1
JOIN ME LIVE ON FACEBOOK IN JUST A MOMENT.
Cleveland leads this series 2-2.
LeBron's second-half turnovers have become a problem for the Cavs. He's just not taking the Celtics seriously enough. Got lucky that time.
I'M GOING LIVE ON FACEBOOK RIGHT AFTER THIS GAME TO GIVE YOU MY IMMEDIATE THOUGHTS AHEAD OF TOMORROW'S UNDISPUTED. JOIN ME.
OK, King. You got your rest. No running out of gas this time. Take this game home. No Celtic can keep you from the rim or the free-throw line.
This game is over and this series is about to be.
LeBron James is toying with the Celtics.

By my count, 3 of tonight's Celtic starters (Jaylen Brown, Jayson Tatum, Terry Rozier) have a total of 229 NBA starts (regular and postseason). LeBron James has 1,374 starts. That's SiX times the starts of 3 starters combined. Mismatch.

How good is Kyle Korver. One of the greatest shooters ever, knows how to play, gives every last ounce playing hard, smart defense. Yet doesn't even start for the Cavs. Does LeBron ever have some help.

When LeBron actually tries to play defense, and inspires his teammates to play D, the Cavs can be a pretty tough defensive club. Tristan and Korver have been particularly impressive on that end. Korver: 2 blocks on Jaylen Brown!

As I said on today's Undisputed, the Cavs will win big tonight. They're just better than the Kyrie-less, Hayward-less Celtics, and LeBron is finally setting the tone he must set on both ends. I got the Cavs in Game 5, too.

The Celtics got put right back in their place. They know they're not as good as the Cavaliers. If the Cavs continue to play this way, and LeBron sets the tone early, I'm not sure the Celtics can win another game in this series. More @Undisputed, now on FS1 https://t.co/EkzgSdo3nD

The Rockets realized their two stars, James Harden and Chris Paul, can't measure up to Kevin Durant and Steph Curry. For the last two games, James Harden is 5-of-21 from 3. Suddenly, we're seeing Playoff James. More @Undisputed, now on FS1 https://t.co/snCRi7NTTH
Will Johnny Manziel ever make it back to the NFL? Now on @undisputed
Who’s more important to the Warriors: KD or Steph? Now on @undisputed

From the start, LeBron James just said, 'I am going to shut down and shut out Jaylen Brown,' and he did. It was highly impressive. It looked like the good old days of LeBron James first-team All-NBA defense. More @Undisputed, now on FS1 https://t.co/1MsuOcItxo
Is it possible Tim Tebow will be called up to Triple A… or even the Mets? Now on @undisputed
Are the Rockets done? Should Jason Garrett be fired? Now on @undisputed
Will LeBron be able to play as hard tonight as he did Saturday night? @undisputed. 9:30 AM ET. FS1
The question in this series just swung from WHAT'S WRONG WITH STEPH to WHAT'S WRONG WITH JAMES HARDEN. "Playoff James" is too often "Way Off James."
I won't be surprised if the Warriors eliminate Houston in 5.
Undisputed returns tomorrow 9:30-noon E as Shannon and I debate LeBron vs Celts, Warriors dominance, Cowboys issues and Johnny Canada. See you then.
Watching that Steph-fueled Golden State explosion made me feel a little sorry for LeBron.
AT HOME Steph, KD and Klay just combined to go 2 of 14 from 3 ... and GSt still leads by 11 at half. That's a very bad sign for the Rockets.
JOIN ME LIVE ON FACEBOOK RIGHT AFTER THIS GAME. SEE YOU THEN.
LEBRON JAMES SHOULD COME OUT OF THIS GAME NOW. Save himself for Game 4. Forget the triple double. Not worth it.
This game is such a blowout that Jeff Van Gundy is going into detail about the Royal Wedding. Ernestine is impressed. Hazel just yawned.
LeBron James: STILL the best passer in basketball.

I don't know who from the Players Association negotiated three days rest after the first two games of the conference finals, but it sure benefited LeBron James. I'm guessing he suggested or at least encouraged it.
That was one of the best all-around halves of playoff basketball I've ever seen LeBron James play.
This one's over. I won't be shocked if the Cavs win the next three games, too. Get real: The Cavs are better than the Celtics.
DEE-FENSE, BRON! Love it!

WAY TO GO, KING: LeBron set the 1st-quarter tone with his DEE-FENSE on Jaylen Brown. In Game 2, while LeBron was scoring 21 in the 1st, he didn't even try to guard JB, who scored 14. Tonight, rested LBJ took the challenge, outscored JB 12-0 in 1st.
Jayson Tatum, just a rookie, said he watched Kobe's critique of Game 2 about 25 times. No, Jayson, he's showing you how to be Kobe, how to be a solo green-light scorer. Not who you guys are.
Kyle Korver should be starting - and for sure he should play a whole lot more than he did in Game 2.
Dee-fense, King!
I will go live on Facebook right after the game to unleash my immediate thoughts.
Cavs 112, Celts 97. The Celts are NOT the better team, not without Kyrie.

Cowboys offseason goes from bad to worse. TWil, arrested. Accused of driving drunk, crashing Lambo. Could be suspended at team's weakest position. Then again, caught 0 TDs last yr. Pick-6 drop vs GBay. Foot surgery. TWon't. Ug.

Good for Johnny Manziel. Go to Canada, consistently show the NFL you can again be Johnny Football on the field while being grown-up, cleaned-up John off it. Long way to go but this is a start, a last start.

When MJ was a year older than LeBron, in his final game for the Bulls, closeout G6 at Utah, he scored 45 of their 87 points and had 4 steals, including the late one from Karl Malone that led to his game-winning jumper. He made NBA 1st team all-defense that season.

I was wrong about Cavs in 5 but I still believe they can and will win Games 3 and 4 in Cleveland. The Celtics obviously don't have Kyrie or Hayward while the Cavs have "the best player on the planet" who is "better than Michael Jordan." That should be enough.

Key for the Cavs in Game 3: Will LeBron, after 3 days of rest, be able to consistently attack and penetrate Boston's D for 4 quarters and will he quit resting on defense? He has fallen to 74th in the playoffs in individual D. The man he's "guarding" has consistently hurt Cavs.

Do you realize the Cavs' winning points came on that slick little spin shot by TRISTAN THOMPSON at the end of the clock with 2:03 left in OT? I keep saying, PLAY TRISTAN THOMPSON. He changes the way the Cavs play basketball.
My partner on Undisputed, LeShannon Sharpe, did not have faith in his Cavs tonight. UNDISPUTED: 9:30 E, FS1. SEE YOU THEN.
I had faith in the Cavs tonight mostly because I do not trust the Raptors in games of this magnitude. And that's what just happened.
That was just a pathetic possession.
TAKE IT TO THE BASKET, LEBRON!!!!!!!!!! YOU HAD IT!!!!!!!!!!! DON'T RUN FROM THE FREE-THROW LINE!!!!!
Not a bad catch-and-shoot try by LeBron for the win after the lid somehow remained on Toronto's basket shot after shot after shot after shot after ...
Great fadeaway make by the King to tie.
I'm sorry the elbow caught DeRozan but this is PLAYOFF BASKETBALL. HE WAS FIGHTING FOR A REBOUND.
THAT IS A TICKY TACK FOUL CALL. SHOULDN'T HAVE BEEN CALLED. WASN'T BLATANT ON LEBRON'S PART.
What is LeBron DOING? No ball movement. Dribble, dribble. Taking threes from Calgary. I know, he made one - one for seven!
Play Tristan Thompson the rest of the way.

I've been saying throughout the playoffs that LeBron constantly steps across the line with his 498th new free-throw routine. It has been working ... until tonight. But they finally called him for a violation.
Come on, Bron. 1-5 from the free-throw line??? Need you, big man. Help your help!

I pick LeBron's Team to win tonight and he runs out of gas IN THE FIRST QUARTER. He led the NBA in minutes played in the regular season and in the 1st round of the playoffs and he has to sit 8 minutes into what's turning into a disaster. I guess the joke's on me.
Join me live on Facebook in just a few minutes to talk LeBron, NBA playoffs, Kawhi to Philly?

No surprise to me that reportedly 6 teams at or near top of draft preferred Baker Mayfield. I said all along that clearly he performed the best of any of the top QBs and is an extremely competitive leader. Off-field risks did not scare them off.

I take back the compliment I paid Belichick for opting not to trade up for a top QB to replace Brady. BakerMayfield's agent now says Pats wanted BAKER at 2 but Browns took him. Giants would've had Pats' 2 firsts and 2 seconds! No new help for Brady! Unreal.
I will go live on Facebook around 7 E to talk if I think LeBron is "burnt," if he'll sweep Toronto, if Sixers are in trouble and if they will trade for Kawhi. JOIN ME THEN.

By his standards, Tom Brady just lashed out at Belichick and even Kraft. We debate. @undisputed. 9:30 AM ET. FS1
All you need to know is the Celtics outscored the Sixers by 36 from the 3-point line and won by 16. That will not continue.
This is just what the Doctor (J) ordered for the young rusty Sixers. They'll be fine.
Terry Rozier is no more of a backup than Nick Foles was.

As much as I like Victor Oladipo, with LeBron out of the game for about 5 crucial minutes, he did nothing. Pacers had their opening to take control. Couldn't. They could keep coming back/hanging around, but didn't believe they could dethrone.

For whatever weird reason, LeBron checked out of yesterday's Game7 w 1 minute left in the 3rd. A 12-pt halftime lead had crumbled to 1. Seconds after he returned about 5 mins later, Cavs led by 12. Kevin Love had hit two 3s & a jumper. Game basically over. Love saved the season.
As a Cowboy fan, I fear these players the Cowboys did not draft will come back to haunt them: DJ Moore, Rashaan Evans, Dallas Goedert, James Washington and Obo Okoronkwo. Sure hope I'm wrong.

Hey, Romeo Langford: I respect & understand your decision to stay in state and play for Indiana. But you should've signed with the best school in the country, Vanderbilt, and joined a recruiting class that could've contended for a national championship.

Rockets are extremely fortunate they're getting Utah without its point guard, Ricky Rubio. Of course, OKC got to play Utah at Utah in Game 6 mostly without Rubio and STILL couldn't pull it out.
The Cavs will sweep the Raptors.

I don't want to hear on tomorrow's Undisputed that LeBron needs more help. Tristan Thompson! George Hill! Kyle Korver! Kevin Love! All played Game 7 big in Game 7 ... especially when LeBron was out with "cramps" or a "minor injury" or why ever he seized up when the game tightened
Congratulations to Victor Oladipo's Team for taking LeBron James' Team to the brink in Game 7. Actually outplayed the Cavs overall. Way to go.
What?! Whatever it takes.
Hmmm. That was a quick goal-tend call and LeBron's wasn't at the end of Game 5??? Whatever it takes, refs.
Who needs LeBron James?
"Cramps" should subside now that the Cavs have this lead.
Drama King.
LeBron sure has had a lot of help while he has been out with "cramps."
Of course, if the Cavs somehow manage to lose this game, LeBron now has his excuse."Cramps."

When LeBron was in Miami, a Heat source told me the Heat training staff found that LeBron cramped under pressure. I wrote that for https://t.co/MTGersKKuG after Game 1 of the 2014 Finals, when LeBron was the only player on the court who cramped when the air conditioning failed.

Defending LeBron with just one guy, the Pacers have blown out the Cavs twice and won 1 close game, while the Cavs have won 3 close games. Advantage, Pacers. But it appears LeBron has saved his best for last.

I've been perplexed for seven straight games over the way Nate McMillan defends LeBron with just 1 no-help guy. LeBron could score just about every time if he wanted. Today he has had a hot hand from outside as well. But I can't argue with the outcomes of the previous six games.
I've said maybe 10 times on Undisputed over the last 10 days: "Play Tristan Thompson!" 10 points, 9 rebounds - 4 offensive. Cavs win the boards by 7. TT changed the game. LeBron had HELP.
LeBron should win this home Game 7 by at least 10.
Sixers in six over Celts.

Amazing achievement by the Celtics, winning their 1st round series without 2 All-Stars, Kyrie & Gordon Hayward. So well coached. So tough, smart on D. "Scary Terry" Rozier has some Kyrie in him. Jayson/Jaylen becoming stars. Won't be any pushover for Sixers.

Bo Scarbrough can be a downhill punisher behind a dominating line - and the Cowboys might provide that. He won't make anyone miss or create holes. No Zeke in him. But could provide quality backup and change of pace.

Not sure what Belichick/Mc/Daniels see in Danny Etling. Llast thing I saw was: "Potential Next Brady." Or even, "Potential Next Jimmy G." Brady will feel no threat - which isn't a good thing.  He's psycho-motivated by challenges. But he still knows his coach wanted to retire him.

I absolutely loved Tavon Austin before the 2013 draft but as a Ram, he never quite lived up to being taken 8th overall. I like the Cowboys getting him for only a 6th-rounder. Maybe Linehan can use him the way Pats do James White while Beasley/Switzer are more Edelman/Amendola.

Mel Kiper on the man who built the Eagles' championship team: "Howie Roseman knows this league better than anybody." AND HE DIDN'T EVEN PLAY HIGH SCHOOL SPORTS! How can he know football if he didn't even play it? Why is Michael Jordan the NBA's worst team builder? Hmmm.

I grew up in Oklahoma City and I hoped against hope Russ/PG/Melo would find a flow and get on a playoff roll. Game 5 was all-time amazing. But the problem was a team I loved all season: Utah. It was simply the better TEAM.

In the end, as always, it was Russ or bust for OKC. He took 43 shots! Took 19 threes! Kept them barely in the game on sheer solo will. But he remains so difficult to play with. Somewhere Kevin Durant is saying, "Told you so."

Paul George turned back into George Paul in a do-or-die Game 6. 2-15. 0-6 from 3. 6 turnovers. 5 points. And I thought he'd be a little better Oladipo for Russ. Good luck to the team that gives him the max thinking he's a savior.

I've watched the Gobert on PGeorge noncall about 100 times. Obviously, JHarden gets that call and 3 FTs every time. PGeorge should've gotten this call. But he did lean sideways, he hadn't made a 3 and OKC was playing such ugly basketball that the refs looked the other way.

I was so wrong about the Thunder. I might never recover from the end of last night's G6. Six straight missed shots in that last-min possession, 3 by Russ, 3 by George Paul. Just ugly. OKC Blunder. I thought we'd see Playoff Melo. He's now just another Anthony.

Browns should just go ahead & start Baker Mayfield Day 1. Stage won't be too big for HIM. Let him fire away to Josh Gordon, Jarvis Landry, Corey Coleman, Antonio Callaway, Njoku & hand or toss to Chubb, Duke or Carlos Hyde. Watch Browns head straight north in the North.
I don't love OKC's chances of staying alive in the 2nd half. Once more it has become Russ or bust. At Utah I'm not sure he and he alone will be enough.
Was I ever wrong about LeBron tonight.

Ozzie strikes AGAIN: I also watched every college game Mark Andrews played. He JUST GETS OPEN. Big rangy tough target with good hands. Someday soon he'll be catching TD passes from a Lamar Jackson protected by Orlando Brown.

Lance Stephenson gets NO CALLS and virtually no respect from the refs. No doubt much of his reputation is self-inflicted. But he plays hard and he makes plays and does not deserve this blatantly unfair treatment.
I do not care about what Orlando Brown did or didn't do at the combine. I watched every game he played at OU. He DOMINATES. Another terrific pick by Ozzie.
I did not watch Michael Gallup so I have no personal opinion. I like what I hear and read about him. Could be pretty good. But I'm pretty sure he's no DJ Moore. And he's definitely no 2014 Dez.
Lord have mercy: The Pacers are EMBARRASING LeBron's Team. I thought they'd be demoralized by getting robbed thanks to LeBron's uncalled goal tend. They were inspired.

I watched former kicker David Akers ridicule Cowboy fans at JerryWorld before announcing the pick of his former team, the Eagles. REMEMBER: 1) Akers' Eagles played the Cowboys once in the playoffs and lost 34-14 and 2) Akers wasn't a real football player.
Stunning: Oladipo just went LeBron on the Cavs. Welcome back, Victor. LeBron is playing with lower energy tonight. Does he want another stat-building Game 7 at home on Sunday???
There went DJ Chark, another receiver who intrigued me. Wonder if Arizona would take the Cowboys' third-round pick for Brice Butler?

Oh, well, there went James Washington, to the Steelers. I can't argue with taking an offensive lineman with the 18th pick in the second round, but I would've been great with JW there, as I tweeted. He has a subtle gear of deep speed Dak would've loved.

I like this pick. Connor Williams, native Texan, is a potential stud offensive lineman who can play every position. Ty Smith struggles to stay healthy. Cowboys sure could've used Connor Williams at Atlanta.
Apparently the Eagles thought the Cowboys were sitting on a potential Witten replacement appropriately named Dallas (Goedert). So Howie Roseman traded up to snatch him. Way to go, Howie.
Christian Kirk to Arizona - that's OK. James Washington to the Cowboys?

I'm afraid the Pacers are done tonight, deflated from being robbed on LeBron's goal tend. Oladipo has been lousy the last 4 games after a breakout season and breakout Game 1. He has reverted. Lance is the only hope. LeBron by 10.
Gesicki goes to Dolphins: ANOTHER receiver I hoped would fall to the Cowboys. Will have impact. Hard to cover.
So much for Courtland Sutton, Cowboy fans. Thanks, John.

Baker Mayfield played way better than any of these other QBs. For the last two years, he led all of college football in Total QBR. That's hard to do. More @Undisputed, now on FS1 https://t.co/G5ReVHtFhz

NFL Hall of Famer Shannon Sharpe and I are about to debate Baker Mayfield vs Sam Darnold, Lamar Jackson to Ravens, Cowboys shocking pick, Patriots surprising strategy, comments made by Josh Rosen and Josh Allen, and Saquon Barkley to the Giants. @undisputed. 9:30 AM ET. FS1
THE place to hear the best draft debate is Undisputed tomorrow 9:30-noon E, FS1, as I match opinions and wits with 3-ring NFL Hall of Famer Shannon Sharpe. JOIN US.

The more I think about the Cowboys' pick, the more it scares me. I'm having flashbacks to the Gil Brandt reach/bust picks of the '80s, when he tried to show the league he knew something nobody else did. I'm even thinking Mike Mamula. Please tell me I'm wrong.

Lamar Jackson obviously has rare breakaway speed, but he also has a lightning release and can flick the ball with underrated velocity. He thrived in Petrino's demanding pro-style passing game. His college production was spectacular. Congrats, Raven Nation.
I LIKE LAMAR JACKSON MUCH BETTER IN BALTIMORE THAN I WOULD HAVE IN BOSTON.

GOOD FOR OZZIE NEWSOME IN HIS LAST DRAFT. JUST TRADED UP TO TAKE LAMAR JACKSON AT 32. I'VE SEEN ENOUGH OF FLUKE-O. I KNOW HE'S BEEN SHOCKINGLY GREAT IN THE PLAYOFFS BUT HE'S BEEN ROUTINELY LOUSY IN REG SEASON. LAMAR IS THE RAVENS FUTURE.
Once again, Brady says, thank you, coach. To me, Sony Michel is as explosive and productive as Saquon. Runs strong AND with effortless acceleration. Very good pick. Knee should hold up fine.
OK, back to the Patriots' reported interest in Lamar Jackson. Real or smokescreen? It would be uncharacteristically unPatriot if it's real. Belichick has never let secrets leak. But now we see.

I'm not the biggest Calvin Ridley fan, but obviously he'll make Matt Ryan's offense even more explosive and fellow Tide product Julio Jones will make sure Ridley sees almost nothing but single coverage.
Steve Smith just spoke the truth ... Carolina has not been able to replace him, until now, with D.J. Moore.
Congrats, Cam. You just got a game-breaking receiver the Cowboys sure could've used: D.J. Moore.
Obviously, unless someone trades up, Belichick could have another shot at Lamar Jackson at 31.

Thank you, Bill Belichick. Brady thanks you, too. Isaiah Wynn is a mauler. Doesn't have prototype size but just steamrolls, at guard or tackle. Kept blowing my Sooners off the line in the national semifinal. Great need pick after losing Solder.

Now we see if all the reports about the Patriots loving Lamar Jackson were smokescreens. Now we see if Belichick goes anti-Brady and picks the next Patriots quarterback when they have so many other needs.
I'm thinking the Titans just said, "Thank you, Cowboys."
I hate to say it, but Rashaan Evans would've been a safer pick for the Cowboys at linebacker than Vander Esch.

What always scares me about kids like Leighton Vander Esch: The entire Cowboys staff/front office fell in love with him BECAUSE HE'S SUCH A LIKABLE KID. But does that cloud their vision of him as a potentially great NFL linebacker??? I don't see Roquan Smith. Hope I'm wrong.

Obviously, Sean Lee's history tells you he just won't stay healthy. I'm not sure Jaylon Smith will ever quite be what he was before his horrific knee injury. Hitchens is history. So LB was an obvious need. But so was a No. 1 receiver.
I watched Leighton Vander Esch just one time, vs Josh Allen. Impressed with his movement - plays LB like a safety. But didn't see physicality. Not a thumper. So ... I can't do cartwheels just yet.
I don't like Calvin Ridley nearly as much as I do D.J. Moore.
Not sure why Green Bay wanted to trade up ahead of Dallas. Were Packers afraid Dallas would take CB Jaire Alexander? Seriously doubt that.

Raiders' rival, the Chargers, take Derwin James. Has Pro Bowl potential at safety ... to pair with the NFL's best cornerback, Casey Hayward of Vanderbilt University. Chargers have Super Bowl potential NEXT YEAR.
I would bet on Tremaine Edmunds becoming a star before I would Josh Allen.
Can't argue with Gruden taking Kolton Miller. But the defense sure could've used Derwin James.
Raiders should take Derwin James.
Saints trade up from 27 to 14 to take Lamar ... no, the defensive end from UT-San Antonio, Marcus Davenport??? I did not watch him. They must think he's going to be a STAR. Biggest curve ball so far.
Da'Ron Payne (like Vea) is an extraordinary athlete for such a big man. Cowboys could've used him. Now, as a Redskin, he will cause my Cowboys problems for years to come.
Vita Vea is HUGE. Plays big, too. A true interior anchor.
I love Minkah Fitzpatrick almost as much as I do Roquan Smith. Just a football player. Corner, safety, whatever. Knows how to play. Competes. Always around the ball. Congrats, Dolphins.

Playing NFL QB requires extreme mental & physical toughness and I'm not sure Josh Rosen has those. Throws a pretty ball. But does he have the intangibles and strength of leadership to take over a team? I have my doubts.
Jimmy G says, thank you, John Lynch. Tom Brady says, man, wish I had a left tackle.
Bears just got a FOOTBALL PLAYER, the best defensive player at his position. Leader, hitter, baller. Another great Bears linebacker. A Chicago-style throwback: Roquan Smith.

I watched Josh Allen at Iowa, at BoiseSt, vs Oregon and in 1st half of Senior Bowl. Just didn't see enough poise, feel, accuracy. Can throw it 80 yards and through a brick wall. But CAN HE PLAY QB? And the high-school tweets gave me pause.
I'm afraid the Bills, who just traded up, are about to swing and miss at a QB.
From all I hear about Quenton Nelson, he's a stud, a Zack Martin. Can't argue. But if I were Denver or Indy, I'd have taken Roquan Smith.

For Elway, who has struggled to pick QBs, Chubb is a safe pick. He'll be a starter and stalwart, but not sure he'll be a star. He's more of an anchor than a difference-maker. Plays stronger than Von Miller but not as slippery and explosive a pass rusher. Elway did pick Von.
I believe John Elway would've taken Baker Mayfield. Now I'll be surprised if he takes a QB.
I like Denzel Ward more than Bradley Chubb ... even though Ward had a long night against Baker Mayfield, who planted his flag at the Horseshoe. But I can see Ward being more productive than Chubb.
For the Jets' sake, I hope Sam Darnold isn't the turnover machine he was at USC. I doubt Tom Brady won't lose any sleep tonight.

Again, I don't LOVE any of these QBs. But I do like BakerMayfield to the Browns. He will take over the franchise and locker room. Pressure/expectation will never bother him. He will make plays. He will talk trash. He will make the Browns a story again.

I don't blame the Giants for taking Saquon. GREAT young man. However good he can be, he will be. But he is no Zeke as a RB. Look at what happened last year at OhioSt and MichSt. Won't be a life-changer. But will help aging Eli.
Incredibly, a kid who had to walk on at Texas Tech, who clashed with Kliff Kingsbury and walked on at Oklahoma, is now the first pick in the draft.

My problem with Darnold is the shocking number of turnovers and sacks last season. Led nation in fumbles lost. 13 INTs. 29 sacks. Great kid who tries too hard, loses poise. Will he crumble under high-pick pressure?

I've been saying for two months on Undisputed, don't be surprised if the Browns take Baker Mayfield. If he can stay out of trouble, he'll be better than the other QBs. But that's a pretty big if. Like Manziel, Baker skilled at telling adults what they want to hear. Eddie Haskell.

Problem now for the Browns is BakerMayfield DOES have some off-field Manziel potential - and they wasted a pick on a Johnny who went over the edge into substance abuse. Mayfield likes the nightlife and promoting himself on social media. If he stays out of trouble ...

1 year ago I said if Cleveland doesn't take Deshaun Watson, it will make a monumental mistake. Now I'm not as sold on any of these QBs, but the one who PLAYED the best (by far) is BakerMayfield. High football IQ, careful risk-taker, extreme accuracy and competitiveness.
The best football player in this draft is Roquan Smith. Leader, hitter, gamer, football player.
The best receiver in this draft is D.J. Moore - just exploded off my screen every time I watched him. I'd be very happy if the Cowboys managed to draft him. Dak would be even happier.

Good for Oladipo calling out the refs for missing the obvious late goal tend on LeBron. I called it immediately. Changes everything. No way LeBron hits that shot after that blunder, when it's do-or-die down 2. Indiana obviously got robbed.
Utah was ahead 71-46! And lost by 8!
Game 6 will be very different at Utah. But I still give the Thunder a shot. And OKC definitely wins a Game 7 back in the Thunderdome.
Russ finally just said, "Let ME do this." That was the only way.

Incredibly, Russell Westbrook has brought OKC back from 25 down midway through the 3rd q vs a very good, hot team. I thought there was NO WAY. But he hit one 3, then another, then he unleashed (with Gobert on the bench in foul trouble).
Stop the presses: Russ might've just SAVED his legacy by willing OKC back into tie with a 20-point 3rd quarter. Now OKC leads, with Russ-stopper Gobert in foul trouble.
Wonder if LeBron is missing DWade and Jae Crowder about now?

Russell Westbrook's legacy is about to take a major hit. After so many big regular-season wins with PG and Melo, and after a dominant G1 win over Utah, Russ's Team has degenerated into disconnected solo acts and 4 straight losses.
Ingles & Crowder have hit 4 threes each. OKC has hit 2 total. That's 18 more points. 56-41 Utah at half. Thunder are done.

By the way, LeBron now has only 4 last-second game-winning jump shots in 1,142 regular-season games and incredibly, only 2 in 222 playoff games. These are rare for him. Never his strength. Enjoy this one.
I can't wait to see Uncle Shannon tomorrow at 9:30 E on FS1's Undisputed. How will he celebrate losing to me AGAIN???

Just hard to believe Victor Ola-uh-oh shot 2-15 yet wound up with the ball and a chance to win the game with 5 seconds left. At 6-4, threw up an absurd prayer against the 6-9 LeBron. But after Indy's G1 blowout, that's 4 straight games that have gone to the wire. Not great, King.

Huge shot, LeBron. Season saver. He has always been at his best when there's no decision to make, no fear of the last-second free-throw line, no "drive it or jack it up?" He went straight up and let it fly WITH CONVICTION. Nothing but net. LeBron at his greatest.
Thank you, LeBron, for winning me my bet with my Shannon Sharpe. He gave me 6 1/2. I did not love my chances in overtime. King me! I win yet another case of Diet Dew.
That sure looked like goal tending.
What a night for the notoriously poor shooting LeBron at the free throw line: 15-15! At this rate, he'll wind up 20-20.
LeBron James is the greatest driver of the basketball ever.
Terrible call. Foul on LeBron. No charge.
Can somebody please explain why Lance played only the last couple of minutes of a third quarter the Pacers lost 32-17?

The King is building this all-time stat castle but only one matters: 6-0 vs 3-5. And the 3-5 includes the all-time superstar meltdown in the 2011 Finals and Ray Allen saving LeBron from 2-6 with the greatest clutch shot ever after LeBron had missed the tying 3.
LET LANCE OUT OF THE DOGHOUSE, NATE, AND PUT HIM BACK IN.
Victor Oladipo has turned back into ... Victor Oladipo.
Just hard to believe LeBron has scored at will, and Oladipo and Collison have been pretty awful, and the Pacers are up 7 at half. Does not bode well for the Pacers.

I'm impressed that for the first time in three games, LeBron hasn't played his energy-saving one-man zone defense under the basket.  But that has allowed Indy some paint mismatches and easier baskets. Bet LBJ goes zone in 3rd q.

I swear LeBron could shoot a layup every time down if he wanted. Pacers will not double him, try to get the ball out of his hands. Make nonLeBrons beat 'em. Lance is the only single defender who remotely bothers him.
Looks like the Pacers are saving themselves for Game 6.
Just hard to believe the Pacers played SO POORLY and SO TIMIDLY and were outhustled to so many 50-50 balls and they somehow lead by 2 after one. If the Cavs' threes start falling, this will get ugly.
LeBron can score so easily against these Pacers. Layup after layup. Remember, these aren't exactly the '98 Reggie Miller Pacers who took MJ to Game 7 in the East finals.

As I said on Undisputed today, LeBron with his 768th new free-throw routine, steps over the line every time before the ball touches anything. Should be called. Never is. But I do like the new form on his shot. Much less awkward.

Shocking news: LaVar reportedly pulls 2 younger sons out of Lithuania because he got mad at the coach. Starting to feel like the only way any of his sons will ever reach their potential is if LaVar coaches them. Maybe in the BIG3?
I expect LeBron to come out in full attack mode, try to go for 20-something in the 1st q like G2. Then we'll see if he can sustain it ... or if he plays any defense.

Congratulations to the San Antonio Spurs for a season to be proud of after their best player quit on them after playing a mere nine games.
The Philadelphia 76ers have ARRIVED. Not only should LeBron be sweating, but the best in the West should be thinking, "Oh, no."
DWade probably just told Ben Simmons: "Take it easy on Bron in the conference finals. Try not to embarrass him. You guys will just be too much for him at his age."

The T-Wolves don't play up to their talent under their current coach ... which makes it hard to be too impressed about what James Harden and Co. just did to Minnesota at Minnesota.

The turning point last night was Lance goading LeBron into the tech that made it Pacers 92-89 ... immediately undone by Lance's forgetting to dribble as he brought the ball up court. So sly ... so not on this planet.

When it comes to playing defense, he's now LeNone.

Patrick Reed has some of Tiger's old brazen mental toughness. He doesn't have Spieth's or Rory's or even Rickie's all-around game but when the stakes are highest, Reed's intangibles are stronger than theirs.

I covered my 1st Masters in 1979 and I can't remember a player making more clutch putts than Patrick Reed just KEPT MAKING all the way home, including a highly missable 5-footer at 17 and easily choke-able 3-footer to win. Didn't hit the ball well enough to win. Putter won it.
Jordan Spieth, the most confidently underconfident major winner ever, rolled all the way to 18 tee ... where he yanked it into the trees and well might have blown another Masters.

Sometimes the golf gods bless the Masters winner with one impossible break - Fred Couples, Sergio last year ... maybe Patrick Reed just now hanging up in the bank at 13. But Spieth will be tough to out-birdie.

Spieth, after birdie at his nemesis 12 and shot-of-the-tournament off pine straw to 13, has a real shot of catching Patrick Reed, who has been losing his driver left and right and does not look in charge. Spieth got a break today playing with best buddy Justin Thomas.
